messages.title: Conservatives hit local schools with 'eye-watering' cuts
messages.content: Ian Stotesbury fights cuts to school budgets.

messages.title: 'Stop the dementia tax,' say Lib Dems
messages.content: LIBERAL Democrats are leading the fight against Conservative plans to target elderly people in need of care.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ian Stotesbury will stand up for local schools and fight 'eye-watering' cuts from central government, whilst ensuring schools are well-funded and teachers are respected.
Fighting against the Conservative 'dementia tax' and ensuring elderly people in need of care are treated fairly.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour admit they can't win in Watford, only a contest between Ian Stotesbury or a Conservative MP.

issues.economy: Fighting to protect jobs and public services against Conservative cuts.
issues.education: Ian Stotesbury will stand up for local schools and fight 'eye-watering' cuts from central government.
issues.health: Lib Dems are fighting against the Conservative 'dementia tax' and for proper funding for our NHS.

endorsements.endorsement: Winner of the Park ward by-election with 55% of the vote.

quotes.text: There is no realistic chance of us winning
Labour four election bloodbath A QUARTER of MPs fear losing their seats

images.caption: Ian Stotesbury and Cllr Mark Watkin visiting a local school.
Lib Dems campaign image featuring Tim Farron and Ian Stotesbury.
